Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2007 05:52PM maryhult wrote: Hi lady4law and bastropian..   This has been my experience...I started out with chemo the last week of Dec '06. A/C and Taxol, I finished in Mar '07.  I had bi-lat mast/reconst  (expanders) in May.  I was not supposed to have rads but the path report said otherwise, it put the orig tumor at over 5cm.  I had my implant exchange July 30 and started rads 2 weeks later.  I have 4 left(yeah!!!!).  So far so good.  Normal reactions ie redness, slight swelling and breaking out.  I made sure throughout the whole process I massaged expanders with cocoa butter.  After implants you have to squeeze from the bottom up real hard and hold it there for a count of 10.  This helps to break up scar tissue.  I am using pure aloe gel now and that seems to be working fine.  I hope this will help you.  Good luck Mary Ann
